tit.e: Zoku Kojidan (collection of narratives complied in the Kamakura period)

sen.j: 続古事談（ぞくこじだん）は鎌倉時代初期の説話集。
sen.e: The Zoku Kojidan is a collection of narratives complied in the beginning of the Kamakura period.
The Zoku Kojidan is a collection of narratives complied during the early Kamakura period.
"The Zoku Kojidan" is a collection of narratives complied during the early Kamakura period.
sen.cmt: The Zoku Kojidan にダブルクォーテーションを追記しました。

sen.j: 跋文によれば建保7年（1219年、同年承久と改元）4月23日成立。
sen.e: According to its postscript, this came into existence on June 14, 1219.

sen.j: 全六巻のうち、現存本は巻三を欠く。
sen.e: This originally consisted of six volumes, but the third volume is missing from the existing series at present.

sen.j: 構成は『古事談』を範とし、「王道后宮・臣節・（欠巻）・神社仏寺・諸道・漢朝」の各巻からなる。
sen.e: The structure of text follows the "Kojidan" (a collection of narratives authored by MINAMOTO no Akikane between 1212 and 1215), and the series consists of the following volumes: 'the rule of right based on benevolence,' 'loyalty,' the third volume is missing, 'shrines and temples,' 'accomplishments,' and 'the Han dynasty.'

Its structure resembles the "Kojidan" (a collection of narratives authored by MINAMOTO no Akikane between 1212 and 1215), and consists of the following volumes: 'The Rule of Right Based on Benevolence,' 'Loyalty,' (missing), 'Shrines and Temples,' 'Accomplishments,' and 'The Han Dynasty.'

sen.j: 所収の説話伝承は『中右記』『長秋記』『中外抄』『富家語』などを出典としている。
sen.e: Stories and legends contained in this collection are originally from the "Chuyuki" (the diary of FUJIWARA no Munetada), the "Choshuki" (the diary of MINAMOTO no Morotoki), the "Chugaisho" (the analects of FUJIWARA no Tadazane), the "Fukego" (the analects of FUJIWARA no Tadamitsu), and so on.

sen.j: 日記・故実書の利用は『古事談』に似ているが、文体は和文（仮名文）で儒教の教訓性を持つ説話が多い。
sen.e: The Zoku Kojindan is similar to the Kojindan in regard to the use of diaries and books of ancient practices and customs, but the literary style of the Zoku Kojindan is Japanese kana text, and stories in this collection tend to have teachings of Confucius.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: Although the Zoku Kojindan shows similarity to the Kojindan in regard to the use of diaries and books of ancient practices and customs, the Zoku Kojindan uses Japanese Kana characters, and its stories tend to include teachings of Confucius.

Although "The Zoku Kojidan" shows similarity to "The Kojidan" in regard to the use of diaries and books of ancient practices and customs, "The Zoku Kojidan" uses Japanese Kana characters, and its stories tend to include teachings of Confucius.
sen.cmt: the Zoku Kojindan、the Kojindan を各々"The Zoku Kojidan"、"The Kojidan" に修正しました。

sen.j: 承久の乱前夜において尚古傾向と末代意識が強く、理想的な帝王の姿を説くのは後鳥羽天皇への諫言が込められているという。
sen.e: Since this was complied on the eve of the Jokyu War, it has a strong inclination toward the respect of old political systems and the pessimism due to the theory of the latter days of Buddhism, and it is believed that it remonstrates with Emperor Gotoba by preaching an ideal emperor.
Since this work was complied during the eve of the Jokyu War, it has a strong tendency to respect old political systems, and to remonstrate Emperor Gotoba by preaching the ideal emperor.
sen.cmt: rewording;does the original English translation correspond to the Japanese text? how does pessimism due to latter days of Buddhism fit into this?
sen.e: Since this work was complied during the eve of the Jokyu War, it has a strong tendency to respect old political systems, and to remonstrate Emperor Gotoba by preaching the ideal emperor.
